snippet: A report issued by the state attorney general calls for a drug-tracking system for painkillers.
abstract: Report issued by New York State Attorney Gen Eric T Schneiderman shows prescriptions for widely prescribed narcotic painkiller oxycodone rose in the state by 82 percent from 2007 to 2010; report supports drug-tracking system proposed by Schneiderman in 2011 in an effort to surge in pharmacy robberies, where pills, not cash, are the target; crime wave is of particular concern on Long Island, where two such robberies resulted in six deaths in 2011.
lead_paragraph: A report issued by the state attorney general calls for a drug-tracking system for painkillers.

headline.seo: Oxycodone Prescriptions Rose Sharply in New York, Schneiderman Report Says
headline.main: Oxycodone Prescriptions Rose Sharply in New York
headline.print_headline: Prescriptions Of Oxycodone Rose Sharply In New York
